data.title: tsserver crashes when adding an `import` statement above an existing `import` statement
data.body:
I wasn't sure if this should go in the typescript repo or here, but I'm reporting it here since it's only reproducible in vscode. I don't know enough about the language server to determine if this is an issue with the server itself, or the way that vscode is communicating with it.

In a file with the following contents:

```typescript
import { foo } from './foo';
```

Insert a new line above and start typing a new `import` statement:

```typescript
import { bar } from './bar';
import { foo } from './foo';
```

The problems tab reports the following error: `[ts] Cannot find name 'impor'` and then completely craps out.

There's no issue if you add the new `import` statement below the existing one.

tsserver log shows the following:

```
Info 205  request: {"seq":70,"type":"request","command":"completionEntryDetails","arguments":{"file":"/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/index.ts","line":1,"offset":2,"entryNames":["import"]}}
Err 206   Exception on executing command {"seq":70,"type":"request","command":"completionEntryDetails","arguments":{"file":"/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/index.ts","line":1,"offset":2,"entryNames":["import"]}}:
Debug Failure.
Error: Debug Failure.
    at parseUpdateExpression (/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:17313:22)

    at parseImportDeclarationOrImportEqualsDeclaration (/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:18821:49)
    at parseDeclaration (/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:18271:28)

Info 213  event: {"seq":0,"type":"event","event":"semanticDiag","body":{"file":"/Users/samson/Desktop/dev/typescript/tsserver-crash-repro/index.ts","diagnostics":[{"start":{"line":1,"offset":1},"end":{"line":1,"offset":7},"text":"Cannot find name 'impor\n'.","code":2304,"category":"error"},{"start":{"line":2,"offset":8},"end":{"line":2,"offset":12},"text":"'foo' is declared but never used.","code":6133,"category":"error"}]}}
```

This is occurring when I set vscode to use the workspace TS version, which is 2.4.0. The problem does not appear when using vscode's version, which is 2.3.4.

- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- Typescript version: 2.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.1
- Extensions: none

data.title: TS files formated with incorrect indent
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders latest
- OS Version: window 10

After some time VSCode starts to format TS using incorrect indent size. So I press `ctrl+shift+F` and get formatting with indent of 4 spaces, while user setting is 2, it is seen in UI.

After I reload window, it starts to format correctly.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/736697/27227697-f1f6b4e6-52bd-11e7-8f1c-ff1f80813497.png)

Quite sure it should be a common bug, but didn't find the issue, I wonder how to get rid of it?

data.title: [themes] Schedule color theme switching (or options in general)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm using a dark theme during night and a light one during day. Lots of people that I know also do this switching. 
It might be helpful to be able to schedule automatic theme switching to the times of day (like night shift in macos/ios). Or; an extension api for changing themes also works.

data.title: Internal Console is not displaying stdout output on node 8.1
data.body:
Version 1.14.0-insider (1.14.0-insider)

my launch.json
```json
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "name": "Launch Server",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/server.js",
            "env": {
                "DEBUG": "*",
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            }
        }
```

Debug console output:
```sh
node --inspect=35293 --debug-brk server.js 
Debugger listening on ws://127.0.0.1:35293/695167d4-ae99-401a-b30f-92228049ed94
Debugger attached.
```
## Couple of issues here:
- although the option seems to be --debug-brk , it doesn't break on first line
- there's no output whatsoever from stdout

## Workaround:

Use the integrated terminal as a console by adding:
```json
"console": "integratedTerminal",
```
to the launch configuration.

## PS:
```sh
[DEP0062] DeprecationWarning: `node --inspect --debug-brk` is deprecated. Please use `node --inspect-brk` instead
```
(from the integrated terminal output)

Temporary fix is to space out the nightly builds.

data.title: VS Code becomes unresponsive using 1.13.1 within a few seconds of opening

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. updated to 1.13.1
2. open up vs code, within a few seconds the IDE is unresponsive
3. and about a minute later a dialog pops up telling me it's become unresponsive offering to reopen/keep waiting or close.

rolling back to 1.13

UPDATE:
Rolling back to 1.13.0 resulted in the same error. when I renamed the file 1.13.1-shared.sock I was able to roll back. this file is located in home/.config/code.
Not sure what the sock file does or whether this is the cause of the issue, but renaming it for the moment did fix it. 

Is anybody else seeing this error?

data.title: Option to link the explorer directory to the internal terminal's directory
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18 Sarah

I used to be a heavy Vim user, but I've finally started to move away from it since VS Code is much easier (to setup at least) and has awesome Vim bindings available. The only thing I'm still missing is a way to integrate terminal usage properly into the editor. VS Code already has a built-in terminal support, which is awesome, but I'd like to request a further feature where changing the directory in the internal terminal would also change the directory shown in the explorer view.

I.e. the areas marked with red would always match to each other, and doing something like `cd ..` would also go up by one directory in the explorer view:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11020883/27218074-550f8ef6-5285-11e7-97ab-072a223677bf.png)

Ideally this would be a full terminal integration, so doing something like `git checkout dev` would also change the integrated git's branch to dev. It's probably best to leave it as an option, not everyone wants this I believe.

data.title: Formatting JavaScript documents incorrectly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-snazzy-operator|aaronthomas|1.1.3|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.19.0|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.7.0|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.4.2|
|auto-complete-tag|formulahendry|0.0.2|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.12|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.9|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.5.5|
|theme-ysgrifennwr|xaver|0.1.4|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add the following to the settings:
"javascript.format.placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForControlBlocks": true,
"javascript.format.placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForFunctions": true,
"editor.insertSpaces": true
2. Change spaces settings to 4, from the original 2
3. Press the "Format Document" shortcut

I expected to see that brackets be put on new lines and that all my tab spaces will change from 2 to 4, but instead, VSCode will place brackets on the same line, as well as change my tab spaces to 2.

data.title: Alt click should force regular selection in the Terminal
data.body: I always use tmux with mouse support in Code. The mouse support prevents me from selecting text in the Terminal. I used to be able to hold <kbd>Shift</kbd> to bypass that behaviour and select text. That doesn't seem to work anymore. Did something change?

data.title: unchanged file is getting saved on ctrl+s
data.body:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open any file 
2.press `Ctrl+s`
3.files is saved and watcher begins processing

data.title: Brackets Matching Highlighting Underline Feature Request

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1703 Build 15063.413

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Editor
2. Write `console.log()` and click on bracket to highlight

Now it's look like this:

![23ne-nk123ne-23c2-23dswa-23dasd gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20873402/27218531-5de04ef0-5233-11e7-85b1-de031caee1e8.gif)

Sometimes hard to detect where the cursor is. My request is about change brackets matching style to underline (optionally):

`"editor.matchBrackets": "underline"`

data.title: [Extension Host] Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, scandir 'C:\Users\...\AppData\Local\GitHub'
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.13.1
- OS Version:Windows 10 Insider Preview 16188.1000

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open or reload window, the SCM does not work.
2. Open dev tool gets the error in console.

Git works in terminal of VSCode.
